summary: This bill, the Border Enforcement, Security, and Trade Facilitation Act of 2025, establishes a pilot program within U.S. Customs and Border Protection. It introduces Image Technician positions (Levels 1 and 2) to review non-intrusive inspection images of conveyances and containers at ports of entry, aiming to identify contraband and potential threats. The bill also details training requirements, assessment protocols, and reporting obligations to Congress on the program's effectiveness and impact. The pilot program is set to sunset after five years.
